Package edu.ncsu.csc316.dsa.tree

Class LinkedBinaryTree<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc316.dsa.tree.AbstractTree<E>
      • edu.ncsu.csc316.dsa.tree.AbstractBinaryTree<E>
        • edu.ncsu.csc316.dsa.tree.LinkedBinaryTree<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - the type of elements stored in the binary tree
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.ncsu.csc316.dsa.tree.BinaryTree<E>, edu.ncsu.csc316.dsa.tree.Tree<E>
    public class LinkedBinaryTree<E>
extends edu.ncsu.csc316.dsa.tree.AbstractBinaryTree<E>
    The LinkedBinaryTree is implemented as a linked data structure to support efficient Binary Tree abstract data type behaviors. Size is maintained as a global field to ensure O(1) worst-case runtime of size() and isEmpty(). The LinkedBinaryTree class is based on the implementation developed for use with the textbook: Data Structures and Algorithms in Java, Sixth Edition Michael T. Goodrich, Roberto Tamassia, and Michael H. Goldwasser John Wiley and Sons, 2014
    Author:
    Dr. King

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      static class  LinkedBinaryTree.BinaryTreeNode<E>
      A BinaryTreeNode stores an element and references the node's parent, left child, and right child

      • addLeft

        public edu.ncsu.csc316.dsa.Position<E> addLeft​(edu.ncsu.csc316.dsa.Position<E> p,
                                               E value)
        Returns a reference to the new tree position that is created to store the given element. The newly created position is added as the left child of the provided position.
        Parameters:
        p - the position for which to add a new left child
        value - the element to add to the tree in the newly created position
        Returns:
        the position that is created as the left child of the provided position
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the position, p, does not represent a valid tree position
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the provided position already has an existing left child

      • remove

        public E remove​(edu.ncsu.csc316.dsa.Position<E> p)
        Removes the provided position from the tree. Returns the element that was stored in the position that is removed.
        Parameters:
        p - the position for which to remove from the tree
        Returns:
        the element that was stored in the position that is removed
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the position, p, does not represent a valid tree position
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if removal of the position is not allowed
